channel.title: Tos
channel.description: How would I add a terms of service like MoparScape has here so that you have to click agree before you could access any part of the site? I don't want to get a DMCA letter from Jagex.

item.title: Tos
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

sageofmali:

Is it illegal to host a private server in the first place?

Yes, it’s breaking the copyright on the RuneScape client. The source, no. The client, yes.

Read full topic

item.title: Tos
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

HcoJustin:

If they wanted to force you to stop using the images you’d have to comply. Regardless of you claiming they belong to Jagex

If they want you, they’ll get you one way or another. Using a Terms of Service agreement will only hinder/slow them down. It’s a good start though.

Read full topic

item.title: Tos
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:4, topic:466351”][quote author=sageofmali link=topic=580229.msg4149217#msg4149217 date=1352346524]
Yeah that’s what I was thinking about doing. Is there anything I should include in the TOS so I make sure that Jagex doesn’t take me down? Because I have a lot of similar stuff to their website: http://sage-scape.com
[/quote]

From what I hear, a TOS isn’t actually very successful considering you’re using copyrighted images anyway and someone could probably easily report it (if Jagex even responds to these queries). This is especially the case since you’re using some of their latest stuff too.[/quote]
What if I say the images and css belong to RuneScape © 1999–2011, Jagex Ltd. ?

Read full topic

item.title: Tos
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

sageofmali:

Yeah that’s what I was thinking about doing. Is there anything I should include in the TOS so I make sure that Jagex doesn’t take me down? Because I have a lot of similar stuff to their website: http://sage-scape.com

From what I hear, a TOS isn’t actually very successful considering you’re using copyrighted images anyway and someone could probably easily report it (if Jagex even responds to these queries). This is especially the case since you’re using some of their latest stuff too.

Read full topic

item.title: Tos
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Yeah that’s what I was thinking about doing. Is there anything I should include in the TOS so I make sure that Jagex doesn’t take me down? Because I have a lot of similar stuff to their website: http://sage-scape.com

Read full topic

item.title: Tos
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Check for a cookie (or save it somewhere like in a session – whatever you want) and make sure that on every page this cookie is checked to see if the user initially agreed to your terms of service. If they didn’t agree or never visited the site – hence the cookie isn’t there and the condition fails – redirect them to your TOS page.

Read full topic
